## About Me
I am a biostatistician in the Centre for Statistical Data Analysis ([CSDA](http://www.embl.de/research/interdisciplinary_research/centres/statistical-data-analysis/index.html))
at the European Molecular Biology Laboratory, Heidelberg, working in [Wolfgang Huber](http://www.huber.embl.de/)'s group.

I am a mathematician by training and obtained a PhD in statistics
(multiple testing methods, with [K. Strimmer](http://strimmerlab.org/)) in 2013. 
Since 2013, I work at the EMBL centre for statistical data analysis 
that helps EMBL scientists to use adequate statistical methods for their 
specific technological or biological research questions and run various
courses. Teaching material from course can be found [here](teaching.html). 
My research is broadly related to the statistical analysis of 
high-throughput sequencing data (RNA-Seq, ChIP-Seq, 4C/HiC, DNA-Seq etc.)
